question.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding the erythroblastosis foetalis condition in a pregnant woman?

options.text: It is a special case arises due to Rh incompatibility or mismatching
Destruction of Rh(+ve) foetal RBC inside Rh(-ve) pregnant mother
Specific antibodies against Rh antigens are formed inside foetal blood
It can be prevented by injecting anti-Rh antibodies to the mother

solution.text: A special case of Rh incompatibilty or mismatching has been observed between the Rh(-ve) blood of a pregnant mother with Rh(+ve) blood from the foetus. This leads to formation of specific antibodies against Rh antigens in mother blood.
